meanings.definition: Judged over a period of time to be of the highest quality and outstanding of its kind.
meanings.sent1: The old car was a classic beauty, admired by all.
meanings.sent2: The black dress she wore was a classic choice for the event.
meanings.sent3: His classic sense of humor always lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her classic taste in music never goes out of style.
meanings.sent5: The classic sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A work of art of recognized and established value.
meanings.sent1: The Mona Lisa is a classic in the world of art.
meanings.sent2: The novel 'Pride and Prejudice' is considered a literary classic.
meanings.sent3: The classic on the wall seemed to wink at passersby.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a classic, like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The classic sculpture stood proudly in the museum, captivating all who passed by.
